title: 114_s2327
content: The "Foster EITC Act of 2015" is cited as the short title. It includes a permanent extension of modifications to the Earned Income Tax Credit. The "Foster EITC Act of 2015" includes amendments to the Internal Revenue Code of 1986, such as increasing the credit percentage for families with 3 or more children and raising the income threshold for joint returns. Inflation adjustments to the Internal Revenue Code include increasing the credit amount to $5,000, updating certain subsection references, and changing the effective date to taxable years starting after December 31, 2014. Additionally, a conforming amendment removes paragraph (3) from Section 32(b) of the Code. The Earned Income Tax Credit is being strengthened with adjustments to increase the credit amount to $5,000 and update certain subsection references, effective for taxable years starting after December 31, 2014. A conforming amendment removes paragraph (3) from Section 32(b) of the Internal Revenue Code. The Earned Income Tax Credit is being enhanced by increasing the credit amount for individuals with no qualifying children to $8,820 and $10,425, effective for taxable years starting after December 31, 2014. Amendments are made to the Internal Revenue Code to adjust for inflation and update references. The Earned Income Tax Credit is being enhanced by increasing the credit amount for individuals with no qualifying children to $10,425, effective for taxable years starting after December 31, 2014. The amendments made by section 6050X apply to taxable years starting after December 31, 2014. Section 4 simplifies the Earned Income Tax Credit.
